titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Collection of Flatbush postcards V1991.067
titlestmt.author: Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:10:25 +0000.

physdesc.extent: 12 items housed in one postcard box.

did.abstract: The Collection of Flatbush postcards consists of 12 black-and-white photographic and picture postcards showing views of streets, houses, churches, schools, and storefronts located in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1825 to 1905. The postcards include historical information pertaining to the subject depicted on each postcard and are labeled "Town of Flatbush Civic and Cultural Association, Inc."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Collection of Flatbush postcards consists of 12 black-and-white photographic and picture postcards showing views of streets, houses, churches, schools, and storefronts located in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1825 to 1905. The postcards include historical information pertaining to the subject depicted on each postcard and are labeled "Town of Flatbush Civic and Cultural Association, Inc."

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for the postcards have not been evaluated. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.
